Name: Capture node screenshot
Description: Can I take a screenshot of a DOM node?
Author: @pankajparashar

Chrome.Notes:
1. In the **Elements** panel, right click on the node and select "Capture node screenshot".
2. It retains visible background colour of elements with no background colour applied.
Chrome.Name: Capture node screenshot

Firefox.Notes: 1. In the **Inspector** panel, right click on the node, and select "Screenshot Node".
Firefox.Name: Capture node screenshot

Edge.Notes:
1. In the **Elements** panel, right click on the node and select "Capture node screenshot".
2. It retains visible background colour of elements with no background colour applied.
Edge.Name: Capture node screenshot

Safari.Name: Capture node screenshot
Safari.Notes:
1. In the **Elements** panel, right click on the node in the DOM tree and click on "Capture Screenshot". 
2. Safari preserves the transparency for the elements with no applied background colour.

Opera.Notes:
1. In the **Elements** panel, right click on the node and select "Capture node screenshot".
2. It retains visible background colour of elements with no background colour applied.
Opera.Name: Capture node screenshot
